claim: Pangolin scales do not appear to be an effective medicine for curing any conditions.

supporting.text: Scientific studies have found no evidence that pangolin scales have medicinal properties.

attacks.text: Scientific studies have found no evidence that pangolin scales have medicinal properties.
Traditional Chinese medicine has used pangolin scales for centuries, suggesting empirical effectiveness.
Some studies may lack comprehensive testing of all potential medicinal properties of pangolin scales.
Modern scientific methods are more reliable than historical anecdotal evidence in assessing medicinal efficacy.
The absence of evidence in multiple studies strongly indicates a lack of medicinal properties.
Traditional remedies often lack rigorous scientific validation and may rely on placebo effects.

supporting.text: Pangolin scales are primarily composed of keratin, the same substance as human fingernails, which has no known medicinal benefits.
